column2: The Ogre race are a distinct species of large, tough and cannibalistic humanoids who originated far to the east.?Ogres are a brutish and war-like race of nomads who were forced from their homes in the Eastern Steppes?near Cathay by their god, the Great Maw,?during the most early times of the world's history.

Maneaters are ogres with significant experience in the wider world, typically as mercenries. "Culturally assimilated" as much as this term could be applied to an ogre, they are more tolerated by humans and other non-ogre species.
A Maneater Ogre with leadership experience, this ogre bring unconventional tactics to the ogre armies. Including, but not limited to: sometimes not charging into the fray like madmen.
Ogres are known for their appetite and cannibalistic tendencies. Eat [Root.GetFirstName] to gain prestige and piety.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] seems to be growing to be quite the plump ogre.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is eating less then expected. If [From.GetSheHe] continues like this, [From.GetSheHe]'ll be a laughing stock for the tribe.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has not taken well your resistence to hunger. After a good beating, [From.GetSheHe] has started to force you to take your daily portion of meat and then some.
You've spent a good childhood, taking always as much food as you could and now it well shows as you are one of the largest ogres of your tribe, tough and intimidating.

You might have had some hit and miss during your childhood, but you've certainly tried your best taking as much food as you could. If nothing else, you've certainly grown to be an ogre of a respectable size.
You didn't care much for appeasing your own hunger, letting other children of the tribe taking the best meat and now it shows. Many in the tribe push you around and laugh at your weakly constitution.
Ogre Chieftains are respected for the girth of their belly. As you are of a relatively weak constitution, many of your warriors have come to believe you not to be the better choice for a leader.
You take the puny [From.GetFirstName] between your arms and start savagely taking chomps off of the poor screaming creature until only a few polished bones remain.
